DataElement.preferredName: Participant Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia International Prognostic Index Risk Score Status Stratification Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The stratification code associated with a participant's CLL-IPI risk score status.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia International Prognostic Index Risk Score Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity._The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia.  It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001)_A list of five factors that help doctors assess how a non-Hodgkin lymphoma patient might respond to a certain treatment or predict the risk of disease recurrence and survival following therapy.  The factors are: 1) patient's age, 2) stage of disease: an indication of how localized or widespread is the disease, 3) LDH levels: serum levels often correlate with the amount of tumor in the body, 4) the number of extranodal, non-lymphatic sites found, 5) the patient's overall health. (from Lymphoma Research Foundation of America glossary (www.lymphoma.org))_The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A condition or state at a particular time.

Property.preferredName: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia International Prognostic Index Risk Score Status
Property.preferredDefinition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia.  It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001):A list of five factors that help doctors assess how a non-Hodgkin lymphoma patient might respond to a certain treatment or predict the risk of disease recurrence and survival following therapy.  The factors are: 1) patient's age, 2) stage of disease: an indication of how localized or widespread is the disease, 3) LDH levels: serum levels often correlate with the amount of tumor in the body, 4) the number of extranodal, non-lymphatic sites found, 5) the patient's overall health. (from Lymphoma Research Foundation of America glossary (www.lymphoma.org)):The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. Concepts.definition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia.  It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001)

A list of five factors that help doctors assess how a non-Hodgkin lymphoma patient might respond to a certain treatment or predict the risk of disease recurrence and survival following therapy.  The factors are: 1) patient's age, 2) stage of disease: an indication of how localized or widespread is the disease, 3) LDH levels: serum levels often correlate with the amount of tumor in the body, 4) the number of extranodal, non-lymphatic sites found, 5) the patient's overall health. (from Lymphoma Research Foundation of America glossary (www.lymphoma.org))
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

Concepts.definition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
